endpoints_summary.summary: Create a new group level policy (Early Access)

details.description:
Get all policies for the requested group

*Group level Policy APIs Access Notice:* Access to our Group level Policy APIs is currently
restricted via "use-group-policy-apis" feature flag and will result in a 403 Forbidden error
without the flag enabled. Please contact your account representative for eligibility requirements.

#### Required permissions

- `View Policies (group.policy.read)`

200.description: The group policies for the requested group

endpoints.summary: Create a new group level policy (Early Access)

details.description:
Create one new group level policy.

*Group level Policy APIs Access Notice:* Access to our Group level Policy APIs is currently
restricted via "use-group-policy-apis" feature flag and will result in a 403 Forbidden error
without the flag enabled. Please contact your account representative for eligibility requirements.

#### Required permissions

- `Create Policies (group.policy.create)`

201.description: A single policy is returned if it is successfully created.

details.summary: Create a new group level policy (Early Access)

details.description:
Delete an existing group-level policy.

*Group level Policy APIs Access Notice:* Access to our Group level Policy APIs is currently
restricted via "use-group-policy-apis" feature flag and will result in a 403 Forbidden error
without the flag enabled. Please contact your account representative for eligibility requirements.

#### Required permissions

- `Delete Policies (group.policy.delete)`

Update the group-level policy.

*Group level Policy APIs Access Notice:* Access to our Group level Policy APIs is currently
restricted via "use-group-policy-apis" feature flag and will result in a 403 Forbidden error
without the flag enabled. Please contact your account representative for eligibility requirements.

#### Required permissions

- `Edit Policies (group.policy.edit)`

200.description: A single group policy is returned if it is successfully updated.

details.description:
Get all policies for the requested organisation.

*Org level Policy APIs Access Notice:* Org level Policy APIs are only available 
for use with Code Consistent Ignores. For information about how to enable Code Consistent Ignores 
see [this](https://docs.snyk.io/manage-risk/prioritize-issues-for-fixing/ignore-issues/consistent-ignores-for-snyk-code#enable-snyk-code-consistent-ignores) 
documentation.

#### Required permissions

- `View Ignores (org.project.ignore.read)`

parameters.description: Select only policies with an expiry strictly before the given time.
parameters.name: expires_before

parameters.description: Select only policies with an expiry strictly past the given time.
parameters.name: expires_after

parameters.description: Select only policies that never expire.
parameters.name: expires_never

200.description: The policies for the requested organisation.

details.description:
Create a new org-level policy.

*Org level Policy APIs Access Notice:* Org level Policy APIs are only available 
for use with Code Consistent Ignores. For information about how to enable Code Consistent Ignores 
see [this](https://docs.snyk.io/manage-risk/prioritize-issues-for-fixing/ignore-issues/consistent-ignores-for-snyk-code#enable-snyk-code-consistent-ignores) 
documentation.

#### Required permissions

- `Create Ignores (org.project.ignore.create)`

201.description: A single policy is returned if it is successfully created.

details.description:
Delete an existing org-level policy.

*Org level Policy APIs Access Notice:* Org level Policy APIs are only available 
for use with Code Consistent Ignores. For information about how to enable Code Consistent Ignores 
see [this](https://docs.snyk.io/manage-risk/prioritize-issues-for-fixing/ignore-issues/consistent-ignores-for-snyk-code#enable-snyk-code-consistent-ignores) 
documentation.

#### Required permissions

- `Remove Ignores (org.project.ignore.delete)`

Get a specific org-level policy based on its ID.

*Org level Policy APIs Access Notice:* Org level Policy APIs are only available 
for use with Code Consistent Ignores. For information about how to enable Code Consistent Ignores 
see [this](https://docs.snyk.io/manage-risk/prioritize-issues-for-fixing/ignore-issues/consistent-ignores-for-snyk-code#enable-snyk-code-consistent-ignores) 
documentation.

#### Required permissions

- `View Ignores (org.project.ignore.read)`

Update the org-level policy. 

*Org level Policy APIs Access Notice:* Org level Policy APIs are only available 
for use with Code Consistent Ignores. For information about how to enable Code Consistent Ignores 
see [this](https://docs.snyk.io/manage-risk/prioritize-issues-for-fixing/ignore-issues/consistent-ignores-for-snyk-code#enable-snyk-code-consistent-ignores) 
documentation.

#### Required permissions

- `Edit Ignores (org.project.ignore.edit)`

200.description: A single policy is returned if it is successfully updated.

details.description:
Retrieve the event history for the given policy.

*Org level Policy APIs Access Notice:* Access to our Org level Policy APIs is currently
restricted via "snykCodeConsistentIgnores" and "ignoreApprovalWorkflow" feature flags
and will result in a 403 Forbidden error without the flag enabled. Please contact your
account representative for eligibility requirements.

#### Required permissions

- `View Ignores (org.project.ignore.read)`

GroupPolicyConditionLifecycle.description: Matches on the project lifecycle - if lifecycle is provided, the policy will only apply to projects with the specified lifecycle.

GroupPolicyConditionSnykAssetFindingV1.description: Matches on the Snyk Asset Finding V1 identifier.

GroupPolicyConditionOrgID.description: Matches on the organization ID - if org ID is provided, the policy will only apply to the specified organization. If no org ID is provided, the policy will apply to all organizations.

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the group level policy.

GroupPolicyConditionProjectTags.description:
Matches on the project tags - if project tags are provided, the policy will only apply to projects with the specified tags.
The value is a list of key:value pairs.
The key and value must be Alphanumeric including - and _ with a limit of 30 characters for each key and value.

id.description: A unique identifier for this particular occurrence of the policy.
The Snyk ID corresponding to this user or service account that created the policy

name.description: Name of the user or service account that created the policy

GroupPolicyConditionBusinessCriticality.description: Matches on the project business criticality - if business criticality is provided, the policy will only apply to projects with the specified business criticality.

GroupPolicyConditionEnvironment.description: Matches on the project environment - if environment is provided, the policy will only apply to projects with the specified environment.

logical_operator.description: The logical operator for the policy condition. Currently only 'and' is supported.

id.description: the UUID of the policy to update.
The Snyk ID corresponding to this user or service account that created the policy

name.description: Name of the user or service account that created the policy

field.description:
field refers to the type of identifier used in the condition of the policy.  The available value is versioned and hierarchical:
- `snyk/asset/finding/v1` : identity of the finding scoped to a Snyk assets (e.g. a repository).
For a given issue, `snyk/asset/finding/v1` can be extracted from the `key_asset` field in the [issues API](https://apidocs.snyk.io/?version=2024-10-15#get-/orgs/-org_id-/issues). 
In addition, finding identities can be extracted from the fingerprints section of the SARIF, which is accessible via the Snyk CLI. More details can be found in the [CLI documentation](https://docs.snyk.io/snyk-cli/scan-and-maintain-projects-using-the-cli/snyk-cli-for-snyk-code/view-snyk-code-cli-results#export-test-results).

operator.description:
Operator for the field to value matching. Currently
only 'includes' is supported, which does an exact
string match on the value.

value.description: The value of the field to match on.

UpdateGroupPolicyAttributes.description:
Attributes of a policy that can be updated.
At least one of 'name', 'conditions_group', 'action_type', or 'action' must be provided.

id.description: A unique identifier for this event.

source.description: The source of the policy creation. Defaults to 'api' if not provided.

UpdatePolicyReview.description:
Review update.

To provide an optional message relating to the review state change, add a string 'message' property to the 'meta' object.

UpdatePolicyAttributes.description:
Attributes of a policy that can be updated.
At least one of 'name', 'conditions_group', 'action', or 'review' must be provided.

In order to update the review field, the caller will need to have the
"Review Ignore Request" permission.

id.description: the UUID of the policy to update.
